text.p: These are the leading stories in the Kenyan press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Government minister Nicholas Biwott and Criminal Investigations Department Director Noah arap Too are among Kenyans cleared of involvement in the 1988 murder of British tourist Julie Ward.
- A woman suspect in the 96 million shillings robbery of Standard Chartered Bank in February claims she was raped and tortured by police.
- The initial one-year contract of the coach of the national football team Harambee Stars is extended to four years.
- Ngengi Muigai defects from opposition Democratic Party of Kenya to opposition FORD-Asili.
- The state withdraws its case against two policemen charged with the murder of two employees of Kenya Power & Lighting Company two years ago.
- Failure by the government to protect the marine environment has cut fish production in Kenya by 40 percent.
- Police release the names of 17 people out of 33 killed in a road accident last Sunday.
- All mentally ill people roaming the port city of Mombasa are to be rounded up and taken to mental hospitals.
- The Somali captors of a Kenyan trawler with at least 30 crew members on board are demanding a five million shillings ransom for the release of the ship.
